results.title: What is physical fitness?
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Eric Horter
results.brief_description: This film defines fitness and includes footage of high school student in action to demonstrates the five elements that constitute physical fitness: cardio-respiratory endurances, muscles endurance, flexibility and body composition. From the sereis “Fitness for living”.

results.title: What is nothing?
results.creator_credit: Barr Films and William C. Crain
results.brief_description: Two young boys explore many ways to use the word “nothing” as they search for its meaning in the dictionary and during their everyday activities.

results.title: What is music
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films and Peter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: Presents the great range of sounds we call music, beginning and ending with a stream and its accidental sounds, Includes music from percussion and blues to ancient Chinese and Aboriginal music along with classical Renaissance and contemporary electronic pieces.

results.title: What is margarine?
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, James Carr and Peter Rolfe Johnson
results.brief_description: Explains the manufacture of margarine. Shows how a proportion of the liquid vegetable oil must be converted into a solid fat before vegetable oils can be blended in the production of margarine. Uses animated diagrams to explain the process of hydrogenation, the function of a catalyst and the types of fatty emulsions. From the series “Vegetable oils and fats”.

results.title: What is life?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Joseph Koenig and Robert Verrall
results.brief_description: What is it that distinguishes the living organism from the non-living, the particular quality common to all living forms? This animated film provides lucid explanation, arresting in colour and form as the facts are presented. It shows what biophysics and biochemistry now perceive as the facts of life concerning evolution and the genetically determining factor of the DNA molecule.

results.title: What is inflation?
results.brief_description: Defines the concept of inflation and the motions open to government in dealing with it. Reconstructs the political, social, and natural factors which have given rise to the new phenomenon of stagflation.

results.title: What is fitness exercise?
results.brief_description: Uses a combination of animation and live-action to illustrate the benefits of physical fitness. A good sorceress teaches a scrawny knight the value being fit on general health and knightly pursuits. As he travels the kingdom he learns the elements of physical fitness, the correct way to exercise, the need to develop personal fitness levels and how being fit relates to health, work, sport and regular routines.

results.title: What is electricty
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare and Langton Gould-Marks
results.brief_description: Commencing with a quick survey of the outstanding discoveries which led to the discovery and use of electric current, this film then answers the question put in the title. Opens with a survey of those outstanding discoveries which led to the development and use of eclectic current. Diagrams are used to explain the concept of matter as composed of atoms, each consisting of a nucleus and revolving electrons, electric current is explained as being a movement of these electrons.
